Teaser: Some good news from last year though; data for the 2014-2015 flu season shows similar vaccination rates for healthcare professionals as in the previous year, but still up from past years.

Headlines: Study Dispels Claim That Childhood Vaccinations Cause Retinal Bleeding
Teaser: A recent vaccination is often used as a defense in child abuse cases, particularly when evidence of retinal hemorrhage is presented. However, a new study shows no temporal link between vaccinations and retinal hemorrhage.

Headlines: 'Announcements' Beat Conversations for HPV Vaccine Uptake
Teaser: HPV vaccination rates among children aged 11 and 12 years were highest when providers announced it was time for vaccination, instead of starting an open-ended conversation with the parent.

Headlines: No Link Between Autism and Flu Vaccination During Pregnancy
Teaser: The safety of vaccines for pregnant women is under constant study; new data reinforce that the ACIP-recommended influenza vaccine is safe for pregnant women and their offspring.

Headlines: Can Breastfeeding Reduce Babies' Pain During Vaccinations?
Teaser: Infants who nurse during vaccinations may cry less and feel less pain than babies who are soothed in other ways, a research review suggests.

Headlines: FDA Expands Quadrivalent Flu Vaccine (FluLaval) Use to Infants
Teaser: GlaxoSmithKline's FluLaval quadrivalent influenza vaccine is now indicated for use in children as young as 6 months of age.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine: Bundling, Vaccine Registry Improve Rates in Teens
Teaser: A new study has found that factors such as vaccine bundling, strong recommendations, and reducing missed vaccination opportunities may lead to HPV vaccination rates that beat the national average.

Headlines: Kids Who Get Some Forms of CAM Less Likely to Get Flu Shot
Teaser: Some families may have been exposed to vaccine-critical views when getting complementary or alternative medicine, which points to opportunities for better education and engagement.

Headlines: HHS Officials: Important Progress on Zika, but Much Work Ahead
Teaser: With $1.1 billion in supplemental funding for Zika now in hand, federal health officials provide an update on Zika virus response.

Headlines: Will Lack of Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Cut Immunization Rate?
Teaser: Public health leaders urged parents not to skip flu shots for their kids just because the spray isn't available. Meanwhile, CDC Director Tom Frieden, MD, hopes an effective nasal spray vaccine can return to the market.

Headlines: Infections Nearly Halved After Meningococcal Vaccine Intro in UK
Teaser: Infant immunization with the Bexsero vaccine led to a 42% decrease in the number of cases of meningococcal B meningitis and septicemia in the first year.

Headlines: AAP: Flu Shot, Not Nasal Spray, Recommended for 2016-2017
Teaser: In addition, the group continued to recommend mandatory influenza vaccination for all healthcare workers, according to a new policy statement.

Headlines: Physicians Struggle With Ethics of Barring Vaccine Refusers
Teaser: The main arguments for firing patients are the threat the unvaccinated pose to others and the threat the refusal poses to the physician-parent bond. Some ethicists say neither argument stands up.

Headlines: AAP: Patient Dismissal Is Last Resort for Vaccine Refusal
Teaser: In a change of course, the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) now says pediatricians can dismiss families for vaccine refusal, but only as a last resort

Headlines: LAIV, Inactivated Flu Vaccine Offer Similar Protection
Teaser: New data on trivalent live attenuated vaccine run counter the ACIP's recommendation that LAIV not be used in the 2016-2017 influenza season because of lack of effectiveness.

Headlines: Third MMR Dose May Be Useful in Mumps Outbreaks
Teaser: The CDC suggests a third dose of measles-mumps-rubella vaccine may be considered to help control mumps outbreaks, but proof of efficacy is needed.

Headlines: Racial Gaps Narrow in Child Health Measures
Teaser: However, stark inequities persist in areas such as infant mortality, asthma, high lead levels, and depressive episodes. Vaccine coverage is up, and adolescent birth and smoking rates are at record lows.

Headlines: Complaint Filed Over Handling of HPV Vaccine Safety Issues
Teaser: An official complaint has been lodged by the Nordic Cochrane Center over the EMA's review last year of the safety of human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines.

Headlines: ACIP Nixes Nasal Spray Influenza Vaccine for Next Season
Teaser: The CDC's ACIP has recommended that live attenuated influenza vaccine, the nasal spray influenza vaccine, should not be used because it was ineffective during the last three influenza seasons.

Headlines: Risk for Febrile Seizure After Multiple Vaccines Is Low
Teaser: The incidence of febrile seizures in children 6 to 23 months of age increased when multiple vaccines are given at once, but the absolute risk remains low, according to new data.

Headlines: AAP Calls for a Full-time Nurse in Every School
Teaser: Nurses should team up with a physician in every district, the policy paper adds. Medical, legal, and societal needs call for highlighting the school nurse role to improve health and school attendance.

Headlines: Vaccination of Preemies With BPD: Risk for Decompensation Low
Teaser: The risk for respiratory decompensation after vaccination of preterm infants with BPD is comparable to that of preterm infants without BPD, according to a new retrospective study.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Generic Tamiflu for Oral Suspension
Teaser: Oseltamivir phosphate (Tamiflu) for oral suspension 6 mg(base)/mL, made by Nesher Pharmaceuticals LLC, is particularly important for patients who can't swallow pills, the FDA notes.

Headlines: Lasker Awards Go to HPV Vaccine Researchers, Planned Parenthood
Teaser: A third award was for research on nutrient-activated TOR (target of rapamycin) proteins that regulate cell growth.

Headlines: AAP Recommends Flu Vaccine for All Kids Older Than 6 Months
Teaser: The AAP recommends everyone aged 6 months or older should receive an influenza vaccine, saying it significantly reduces the risk for serious illness and death during the influenza season.

Headlines: AAP Recommends Newborn Hepatitis B Vaccine by 24 Hours of Age
Teaser: The AAP recommendation endorses ACIP guidelines and reflects efforts to eliminate perinatal transmission of the virus, the authors write.

Headlines: Vaccines Have Changed the Epidemiology of Acute Otitis Media
Teaser: Acute otitis media incidence has dropped since 1989, but risk factors remain: attending day care, having a family history, or having it at a young age. Editorialists say vaccination should continue.

Headlines: Measles Vaccine Study Findings a 'Wake-up Call'
Teaser: Further declines in measles vaccine coverage could make the disease endemic again in the United States, the authors warn.

Headlines: Nearly 13 Million Infants Worldwide Unimmunized in 2016
Teaser: Since 2010, the percentage of children who received the full course of routine immunizations has stalled at 86%, below the global coverage target of 90%.

Headlines: ACIP Updates Meningococcal B Vaccine Recommendations
Teaser: The ACIP has updated its recommendations regarding the use of the two- and three-dose schedules of MenB-FHbp vaccine; recommendations for the use of MenB-4C are unchanged.

Headlines: Large Study Shows Reduced Oral HPV Infections With Vaccine
Teaser: Rates of oral HPV infection were reduced in young adults who had been vaccinated, suggesting protection from oropharyngeal cancer.

Headlines: Pediatric Influenza Deaths Concentrated in Unvaccinated Kids
Teaser: Most of the children and adolescents who died from influenza were unvaccinated, a new analysis has found.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Trumenba for Meningococcal Disease Prevention
Teaser: The Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use recommended marketing authorization for Trumenba for immunization against invasive meningococcal disease caused by meningococcal serogroup B bacteria.

Headlines: First Global Guide: HPV Vax for Cervical Cancer Prevention
Teaser: The guide, which takes into account financial and structural resources in various countries, comes from the American Society of Clinical Oncology.

Headlines: Trump Vaccine Commission Still a Go, says Kennedy
Teaser: Robert F. Kennedy Jr, who believes the vaccine preservative thimerosal has led to an uptick in neurodevelopmental disorders in children, says a vaccine safety commission under Trump is still a go.

Headlines: Leading Health Groups Tell Trump: Vaccines Safe, Save Lives
Teaser: More than 350 organizations have sent a letter to President Trump expressing their 'unequivocal support' for the safety of vaccines.

Headlines: New Child Vaccine Schedule Alters Tdap Timing, Cuts HPV Doses
Teaser: The updated recommendations clarify timing for Tdap vaccination of pregnant teens, warn against LAIV use, and narrow the window for hepatitis B vaccines to within 24 hours of birth.

Headlines: US Cancer Centers Again Support HPV Vaccination
Teaser: A statement issued jointly by 69 cancer centers across the United States endorses HPV vaccination and emphasizes that it offers cancer protection.

Headlines: Vaccine Critic Robert Kennedy Jr Says He'll Head Trump Safety Panel
Teaser: Kennedy has promoted the widely debunked notion that childhood vaccines cause autism, a view voiced by the president-elect. One infectious disease expert said Trump shouldn't turn to "conspiracy theorists."

Headlines: Cleveland Clinic Wellness Doctor Backs Off Antivaccine Column
Teaser: Some critics said Clinic's embrace of "wellness" puts its medical credibility at risk.

Headlines: Ebola Vaccine 100% Effective in Clinical Trial
Teaser: An experimental Ebola virus vaccine was 100% effective, a new study has shown.

Headlines: CDC: Two-Dose Regimen of HPV Vaccine Sufficient Up to Age 15
Teaser: A three-dose regimen is still recommended for people aged 15 years or older or who are immunocompromised, the agency said.

Headlines: Will You Get the Flu Vaccine This Year?
Teaser: Despite a relatively severe influenza season last year, clinician vaccination rates remain flat.

Headlines: Maternal Tdap Vaccination and Neonatal Immunity, Timing Key
Teaser: Maternal Tdap vaccination provided greater neonatal immunity when administered early in the third trimester, according to a new study.

Headlines: New Flu Vaccine Recommendations From AAP
Teaser: All children aged 6 months and older should receive an injectable influenza vaccine as soon as the vaccines become available, by the end of October, the American Academy of Pediatrics says in a new policy statement.

Headlines: Russian Trolls Fan Flames in U.S. Vaccine Debate
Teaser: Some of the same Twitter accounts that tried to influence the outcome of the 2016 U.S. presidential election have sent messages to amplify strong views - both pro and con - about the safety and effectiveness of vaccines, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: CDC's ACIP Updates Flu Vaccine Advice for Upcoming Flu Season
Teaser: The quadrivalent live attenuated influenza vaccine (LAIV4; FluMist Quadrivalent) is now an option for appropriate individuals.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Just 25% Effective Against Dominant Strain This Year
Teaser: CDC advised everyone age 6 months or older to get vaccinated and urged early use of antivirals for very sick or high-risk patients who present with flu symptoms.

Headlines: Flu Season as Intense as 2009 Pandemic
Teaser: Ten more children have died of influenza, the CDC said in their weekly flu update; infections are still on the rise.

Headlines: Influenza Hospitalizations Highest on Record, CDC Says
Teaser: Overall hospitalizations for influenza-like illness are at their highest since the CDC began collecting such data, and the season has yet to peak, according to new government information.

Headlines: Is It Influenza or Adenovirus?
Teaser: Some cases among the ongoing influenza-like illness outbreaks in the United States may be not caused by influenza virus but by a human adenovirus type 4 variant usually found in military settings.

Headlines: CDC Says Influenza Activity as Widespread as 2009 Pandemic
Teaser: The agency said baby boomers now have the second-highest hospitalization rate, and the pediatric death rate is especially alarming.

Headlines: Don't Forget! Reminders Boost Vaccination Rates
Teaser: Reminding patients or families they are due for immunizations via phone calls, email, postcards, or texts increases vaccination rates for children, adolescents, and adults, a systematic review has shown.

Headlines: US Influenza Activity Widespread and Intense, May Be Peaking
Teaser: The US is experiencing a very active flu season and early signs suggest that the season may be severe, federal health officials say, with 'almost a doubling' of hospitalizations in just the past week.

Headlines: ACIP Now Recommends Third Dose of Mumps Vaccine
Teaser: With the number of cases at a 10-year high, the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices recommends an additional dose of a mumps-virus-containing vaccine for people at high risk in an outbreak.

Headlines: New Guideline: Flu Vaccine Safe for Persons With Egg Allergy
Teaser: Authors of updated guidance say that no special precautions are needed for flu shots in people allergic to eggs.

Headlines: Seasonal Flu Deaths More Common Worldwide Than Expected
Teaser: A new CDC study shows that up to 646,000 people a year worldwide die from seasonal influenza-related respiratory illnesses, with some groups and regions hit harder than others.

Headlines: Influenza Activity Increasing in United States, CDC Says
Teaser: Although influenza activity was low in the United States in October, November has seen an increase in infection.

Headlines: Heplisav-B Vaccine for Hep B Finally Wins FDA Approval
Teaser: Rejected twice before by the agency, the new vaccine must undergo a large postmarketing study on the risk for acute myocardial infarctions and immune-mediated diseases.

Headlines: Social Media May Help Pregnant Moms Overcome Vaccine Fears
Teaser: Use of an evidence-based, vaccine-friendly website with social media was associated with higher rates of infant vaccination, researchers reported.

Headlines: Kindergarten Vaccination Rates Hold Steady
Teaser: Vaccination coverage rate data can help public health officers identify programmatic actions that might increase vaccination rates among certain pockets of undervaccinated kindergartners.

Headlines: 'Susceptibility Pockets' Driving Uptick in US Measles Cases
Teaser: Pockets of unvaccinated individuals appear to be driving an uptick in the incidence of measles in the United States, not waning vaccine efficacy, an analysis has found.

Headlines: Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Safe for Children With Asthma
Teaser: Children with asthma and recurrent wheezing can safely receive the nasal spray influenza vaccine, a large study found.

Headlines: Are You Seeing Measles in Your Practice?
Teaser: Confirmed measles cases have reached the highest levels this century.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Vaccine for Dengue, With Restrictions
Teaser: Dengvaxia is for the prevention of dengue disease caused by all dengue virus serotypes in people aged 9 to 16 years who have previously had laboratory-confirmed dengue infection and who live in endemic areas.

Headlines: Measles Cases Approaching Highest Level in Almost 2 Decades
Teaser: This year, the number of measles cases in the United States is expected to be the highest since the disease was eliminated here in 2000, according to the CDC.

Headlines: CDC: 90 New Measles Cases, Nearing Record Since Elimination
Teaser: A total of 555 measles cases have occurred this year, surpassing 372 last year and approaching 667 in 2014, according to the CDC. Vaccination refusal is the primary driver of the disease outbreaks.

Headlines: Autism, Depression Tied to Prenatal Maternal Infection
Teaser: A study of more than 1.5 million children suggests those who had been exposed to maternal infection in utero are at significantly greater risk of developing autism or depression during their lifetime.

Headlines: Measles Cases Continue to Rise in US
Teaser: Measles outbreaks have been reported in six states, and confirmed cases have been reported in 12 others, according to a new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Headlines: Tetanus Remains a Threat to Unvaccinated
Teaser: A recent case of tetanus in an unvaccinated child shows that this condition still poses a danger to people who are not vaccinated.

Headlines: Senate Panel Tackles US Measles Outbreaks, Vaccine Exemptions
Teaser: Influential senator seeks feedback on combating the work of 'charlatans and Internet fraudsters' who spread misinformation about the measles vaccine.

Headlines: More Severe Strain of Flu Now Dominant as Pediatric Deaths Rise
Teaser: Influenza activity continues to be elevated in the United States amid 15 more reported pediatric deaths, bringing the total to 56 this season, according to a weekly report from the CDC.

Headlines: Lawmakers Seek to Increase Use of Measles Vaccine Amid Outbreaks
Teaser: Members of the US House of Represenatives used a Wednesday hearing to promote use of the measles shot. They also delved into the factors that keep parents from having their children vaccinated.

Headlines: Vaccine Storage Too Often Fails to Meet Standards
Teaser: Some vaccines being transported to clinics in California were found to be frozen, thereby lowering their effectiveness; in the past 13 months alone, 117 kids received possibly compromised vaccines.

Headlines: ACIP Releases 2019 Child and Teen Vaccine Schedule
Teaser: FluMist for influenza returns as an option this year, although the American Academy of Pediatrics still prefers that kids get the shot. Homelessness is added as an indication for hepatitis A vaccination.

Headlines: Measles Outbreak Worst in Decades for Washington, New York
Teaser: The states of Washington and New York are seeing the worst measles outbreaks in a generation; officials say failure to vaccinate children against the disease is responsible.

Headlines: Sanofi's Pediatric Hexavalent Vaccine Approved by U.S. FDA
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved Sanofi's new pediatric vaccine immunizing children against six diseases, the French pharmaceutical lab said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Halves Risk of Hospitalization
Teaser: Vaccination halved the risk of influenza-associated hospitalization among US adults during the 2015-2016 flu season, new data show.

Headlines: Cell-Based Quadrivalent Flu Vaccine Recommended by EMA Panel
Teaser: The EMA CHMP has recommended granting marketing authorization for Flucelvax Tetra (Seqirus Netherlands BV), a quadrivalent cell-based influenza vaccine.

Headlines: EU Panel Recommends Marketing Authorization for Dengue Vaccine
Teaser: The EMA CHMP has recommended marketing authorization for a dengue tetravalent vaccine against dengue virus serotypes 1, 2, 3, and 4.

Headlines: Several Influenza Deaths Reported in US as Flu Season Begins
Teaser: Several patients including one child have died from influenza as the first week of the 2018-19 flu season drew to a close, according to news and public health department reports.

Headlines: Vaccine Exemptions Up for Third Year in a Row, CDC Reports
Teaser: Although overall vaccination coverage is high, coverage could be improved in several states, including Oregon and the District of Columbia, the agency said.
